page.title: 10HEPWORTH FEAST
page.content: Hepworth Feast started after the Great Plague ended. Held on a Monday on or after the 24th of June, the village school closes and there is a parade with a band which plays in the afternoon and evening. At the 1985 parade there were 15 bandsmen playing in the Hepworth Silver Band. Formerly there was a fair and a village cricket match with races in the evening, now there are only races. There are races for girls and boys, sprint races and sack races and a relay race for local schools. In 1985 Scholes Junior school won the relay. About 120 people walked on the parade, which left the school, went up through the village down to Dean Bridge up to Scholes, through Jackson Bridge and back up to Hepworth. The band played near the Butchers Arms and the school in Scholes.
